CatDescriptText: Mr. James Strothers, hod carrier, 506 Oakwood Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 18, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think taverns should be permitted to remain open and dispense alcohol beverages until at least 2 A.M. Sundays? Do you favor the sale of beer and wine on Sundays in Pennsylvania, like some other states permit?" answer reads: "No, I think that they are open long enough.  With the present hours, the people still have enough time to get into trouble, and still be ready to go to church in morning.  As for the sales on Sunday, it is all right if the taverns open up, after church services."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of James Strothers wearing cap and short sleeved grid patterned shirt, standing outside of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
